## Conversation that answers the provided questions:
**User:**
I'm really interested in what Verus can do, particularly for non-technical users. What capabilities does Verus offer for users to create their own tokens or blockchains without needing to be a programmer?

**AI Assistant:**
Verus is designed to be accessible to everyone, regardless of technical expertise. Verus allows any user with an ID to create their own token currency or even a full-fledged, multi-currency, ID-issuing blockchain that can send and receive from the Verus chain. This blockchain can be 50% POW/50% POS and 51% hash attack resistant. Additionally, these blockchains, known as PBaaS chains, can be merge-mineable and stakeable with other blockchains in the Verus network. This means you can create your own blockchain without needing to write any code, and it will be secure and compatible with the Verus ecosystem.

**User:**
That's amazing! I've heard about DeFi and liquidity pools, but I'm not entirely sure what they do. What is the significance of DeFi liquidity pools and fractional currency baskets in Verus?

**AI Assistant:**
In Verus, any ID owner can define DeFi fractional basket currencies with one or more asset currencies backing the liquidity pool at a fractional percentage. The Verus DeFi protocol solves and prices all currency conversions that use a particular liquidity pool and are mined into one block simultaneously, addressing issues like miner extracted value (MEV) and front-running. This integration of DeFi liquidity pools into the consensus and cross-chain bridge protocols provides fee-based incentives to miners and stakers, ensuring smooth consensus operation and fee conversion capabilities. In other words, DeFi liquidity pools in Verus enable the creation of complex, asset-backed currencies that can be used for a wide range of financial applications, all while ensuring the security and integrity of the network.

**User:**
That sounds really powerful. How do blockchain and liquidity pool launches work in Verus?

**AI Assistant:**
In Verus, the launch of a new blockchain can be accompanied by the launch of a fully decentralized or centralized "bridge" converter liquidity pool. This bridge converter currency has the same flexibility as other fractional 100% asset-backed or partially asset-backed currencies, but is bound to the launch of the new blockchain and runs on the new blockchain. This means that when you launch a new blockchain in Verus, you can also create a liquidity pool that enables seamless conversion between your new blockchain and other blockchains in the Verus network. This makes it easy to bootstrap your new blockchain and start using it right away.
What capabilities does Verus offer for users to create their own tokens or blockchains without needing to be a programmer?

Verus allows any user with an ID to create their own token currency or even a full-fledged, multi-currency, ID-issuing blockchain that can send and receive from the Verus chain. This blockchain can be 50% POW/50% POS and 51% hash attack resistant. Additionally, these blockchains, known as PBaaS chains, can be merge-mineable and stakeable with other blockchains in the Verus network.

ed on non-Verus systems.
## Multi-currency, user created, decentralized tokens and merge-mineable, interoperable blockchains without programming
 - Enables any user with an ID to create their own token currency or even full fledged, multi-currency, ID-issuing 50% POW/50% POS, 51% hash attack resistant blockchain that can send and receive from the Verus chain which launched it. All PBaaS chains run from the same daemon, and projects may choose to join the worldwide Verus community in improving the daemon. In doing so, they will start with a complete, multi-currency, ID-capable blockchain with DeFi capabilities that is merge-mineable and stakeable with other blockchains in the Verus network.
## Consensus integrated DeFi liquidity pools and fractional currency baskets
- Any ID owner may define Verus DeFi fractional basket currencies with one or more asset currencies backing the liquidity pool at a fractional percentage ranging from 5% to 100% backing. The Verus DeFi protocol ensures that all currency conversions that use a particular liquidity pool and are mined into one block are solved and priced simultaneously, addressing the problems of miner extracted value (MEV) and front-running, while providing fee-based DeFi integrated incentives to miners and stakers, ensuring smooth consensus operation and fee conversion capabilities by integrating DeFi liquidity pools directly into the consensus and cross-chain bridge protocols.
## Simultaneous blockchain and blockchain liquidity pool launches
 - Launch of a world class, worldwide, merge-mineable blockchain along with a fully decentralized or centralized “bridge” converter liquidity pool as part of defining a new blockchain.
